page.description: Contains controls and other elements that can be "injected" into other locations in a UX Component, such as a DIV or List Footer.

discussion.p: The *[ui:Injectible]* container is a special type of container used to render controls in a different location in a UX Component.
When you use an *[ui:Injectible]* container, you can specify the target as a *[ui:div]* or *[ui:placeholder]*.

The content placed inside an *[ui:Injectible]* container is rendered inside the target *[ui:div]* or *[ui:placeholder]*, rather than at the location in the UX component where a regular *[ui:Container]* would be rendered.

You can also specify that the *[ui:Injectible]* container's content location should be *[ui:Unspecified]*. The *[ui:Unspecified]* option is typically used if you plan to inject the content into the header or footer section of a *[ui:List]* control.
